Mandate.definition: a formal communication from a reviewing court notifying the court below of its judgment and directing the lower court to act accordingly b
Mandate.origin: [Latin mandatum , from neuter of mandatus , past participle of mandare to entrust, enjoin, probably irregularly from manus hand + -dere to put]

1 a.definition: a formal communication from a reviewing court notifying the court below of its judgment and directing the lower court to act accordingly

2.definition: an act by which a person gives another person the power to transact for him or her one or several affairs

3 a.definition: an authoritative commanda clear authorization or direction [the of the full faith and credit clause ""]

sub_terms.b: the authorization to act given by a constituency to its elected representativevt

man·dat·ing.definition: to make mandatory or required [the Pennsylvania Constitutiona criminal defendant's right to confrontation ""]
man·dat·ing.s: a criminal defendant's right to confrontation "
